intro: Sclarea aethiopis, commonly known as Ethiopian angelica, is a perennial herb native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Sclarea aethiopis is often found in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its roots and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
